domain_description: Cryptocurrency naming and market performance prediction using narrative advantage theory

recommended_transformers.rationale: Crypto names encode technical identity through morpheme selection and naming conventions. Analysis of semantic fields (technical, financial, conceptual) reveals narrative positioning strategy
Growth and innovation-oriented language in crypto names predicts investment appeal. Future-oriented narratives attract capital in speculative markets
Cryptocurrency ecosystem effects: coins gain meaning through co-occurrence patterns with Bitcoin, Ethereum, and category leaders. Network positioning predicts survival
Portfolio complementarity: successful crypto names differentiate through non-overlapping semantic territory while maintaining category coherence
Semantic clustering reveals narrative categories in crypto naming (DeFi, memecoins, enterprise blockchain, etc.). Cluster membership predicts market behavior
TF-IDF baseline for comparison. Pure frequency statistics without narrative interpretation

hypotheses_to_test.name: Story quality predicts better than demographics
hypotheses_to_test.relevance: Test if narrative features in crypto names outperform basic phonetic features alone
hypotheses_to_test.test_method: Compare narrative transformers vs statistical baseline
hypotheses_to_test.success_criteria: Narrative F1 > Baseline F1 by at least 5 percentage points

hypotheses_to_test.name: Character role complementarity
hypotheses_to_test.relevance: Test if crypto names with complementary semantic profiles predict portfolio diversity and survival
hypotheses_to_test.test_method: RelationalValueTransformer features correlation with market cap
hypotheses_to_test.success_criteria: Complementarity score positively correlates with success (r > 0.10, p < 0.05)

hypotheses_to_test.name: Ensemble diversity predicts openness
hypotheses_to_test.relevance: Test if coins with diverse semantic elements and network positioning show better market performance
hypotheses_to_test.test_method: EnsembleNarrativeTransformer diversity metrics vs market cap
hypotheses_to_test.success_criteria: Diversity score positively predicts top 25% membership (AUC improvement > 0.03)

hypotheses_to_test.name: Omissions more predictive than inclusions
hypotheses_to_test.relevance: Test if what crypto names AVOID (e.g., scam markers, complexity) matters more than what they include
hypotheses_to_test.test_method: Ablation studies removing positive vs negative features
hypotheses_to_test.success_criteria: Negative feature set explains more variance than positive feature set

hypotheses_to_test.name: Context-dependent weights outperform static
hypotheses_to_test.relevance: Test if relative features (vs cohort) predict better than absolute features
hypotheses_to_test.test_method: Compare models with relative_* features vs absolute features only
hypotheses_to_test.success_criteria: Relative features improve F1 by at least 3 percentage points

pipeline_config.hypothesis: Narrative quality in cryptocurrency names—measured through nominative analysis, narrative potential, ensemble effects, relational value, and semantic coherence—predicts market capitalization success better than statistical baselines or demographic features alone
pipeline_config.expected_outcome: Narrative features achieve F1 > 0.70 on top 25% prediction, outperforming TF-IDF baseline (expected ~0.60) and demographic-only features (~0.55)
domain_assumptions: Crypto names are chosen strategically to signal quality and category membership
Market participants (investors, traders) respond to narrative signals in names
Technical sophistication in naming correlates with project legitimacy
Meme-oriented names appeal to retail but may limit institutional adoption
Network effects in crypto mean ecosystem positioning matters
Competitive context (cohort performance) moderates name effects

steps.name: nominative_analysis
steps.rationale: Extract semantic fields and naming conventions that reveal technical vs playful vs financial positioning

steps.name: narrative_potential
steps.rationale: Measure future-orientation, innovation language, and growth narrative strength

steps.name: ensemble_effects
steps.rationale: Capture ecosystem positioning and network effects through co-occurrence analysis

steps.name: relational_value
steps.rationale: Assess portfolio complementarity and differentiation strategies

steps.name: semantic_clustering
steps.rationale: Reveal latent semantic categories through dimensionality reduction and clustering

steps.name: classifier
steps.rationale: Gradient boosting handles mixed feature types well and provides feature importance

experiment_config.description: Comprehensive test of narrative advantage theory on cryptocurrency market capitalization prediction

baselines.name: Demographics Only
baselines.description: Use only pre-extracted phonetic and competitive context features (24 features)
baselines.rationale: Test if narrative extraction adds value beyond existing features

baselines.name: Statistical TF-IDF
baselines.description: Pure TF-IDF on narrative descriptions without semantic interpretation
baselines.rationale: Test if narrative semantics outperform frequency statistics

baselines.name: Random Classifier
baselines.description: Stratified random predictions for chance performance baseline

ablation_studies.name: Remove Competitive Context
ablation_studies.description: Remove all relative_* and zscore_* features to test competitive effect

ablation_studies.name: Remove Phonetic Features
ablation_studies.description: Test narrative transformers without phonetic features
